pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.2: the monks from the group of six groundlessly charged a monk with an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.3: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.4: “How could the monks from the group of six do this?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.8: “… Foolish men, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.9: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.10: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.11.1: ‘If a monk groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.8: not seen, not heard, not suspected.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.12: if he accuses him or has him accused, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.1: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.2: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.3: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.4: If he charges someone with failure in conduct or of failure in view, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.5: If he charges one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.6: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.7: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.8: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.2: if he accuses someone, or has someone accused, according to what he has perceived;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.5: The sixth rule, the training rule on groundless, is finished.
